page.title: 17RELIGION IN TERLING
page.content: The first mention of a church in Terling was in 1227.The church registers date from 1538.Terling Church on Church Green has a sundial on the south wall in Greek, which translated means "LOOK IN AND YOU SEE YOUR FATE". At the present time there are no stained glass windows in the church. Services vary weekly to include old and new forms of service, with a Children's Church once a month as well as a weekly Sunday School. The United Reform Church has existed since 1662, when members broke away from the Church to worship at the Manse.The present Chapel, the oldest in Essex, was built on the Green opposite All Saints in 1753. When they moved to the Chapel they brought with them the fine 17th century clock, candelabra and pulpit. Services are held fortnightly by a Witham Minister for about ten.
